facts.1: International Yoga Day is celebrated on June 21st to raise awareness about the benefits of practicing yoga.
facts.2: The day was established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2014, following a proposal by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
facts.3: Yoga is an ancient practice that promotes physical, mental, and spiritual well-being through various postures, breathing exercises, and meditation.

facts.1: National Selfie Day is observed on June 21st to celebrate the popular trend of taking selfies and sharing them on social media.
facts.2: The day encourages people to capture moments, express themselves, and connect with others through selfies.
facts.3: Selfies have become a significant part of modern culture, with millions of selfies taken and shared every day.

facts.1: World Music Day, also known as Fête de la Musique, is celebrated on June 21st to promote the enjoyment and appreciation of music.
facts.2: The day was first celebrated in France in 1982 and has since spread to over 120 countries around the world.
facts.3: World Music Day encourages musicians of all levels to perform in public spaces, bringing communities together through the universal language of music.
